newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei ends up, economic concerns cap upside.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei ends up, economic concerns cap upside.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei stock index futures ended a shade higher on Monday but buying was sluggish on concerns over the pace of Japan's economic recovery, dealers said.
"Although the (recent) tankan was reassuring, there is a lingering concern Japan's economic recovery might be a bit slow," a dealer with a Japanese institution said.
After hitting a high of 20,680 in the morning, September Nikkei contract settled at 20,555, up 20 points from Friday. Volume was light, at 7,390 lots.
"I expect we will see more volumes in SIMEX but the volatility will still be there because this market is very speculative," he said.
The MSCI Taiwan stock index for July shed 1.7 points to settled at 384.60, shrugging off the seven year high close on Taipei's stock market on Monday.
"SIMEX has been moving up the past weeks and have priced in most of the bullishness," said a local dealer.

He said news that Taiwan's Securities and Futures Commission would lift a ban on local trading of offshore Taiwan stock index futures in Singapore and Chicago from August 1, 1997, was in line with expectations.
